description.narrative:
In the last eight months (July 2016 - Feb 2017) Uganda has continued to receive asylum seekers from South Sudan following an extended period of instability in parts of the country. The refugee influx to Uganda especially through the border points at Ngomoromo, Waligo, Aweno Olwiyo and Madi Opei - all in Lamwo District has led to proposal of settlement site in the district. The proposed site covers part of Palabek Gem, Palabek Kal and Palabek Ogili sub-counties.
In preparation for ground-setting, UNHCRin partnership with Lamwo District Local Government (District Water Office; District Environmental Health Office; and the Local authority), LWF, UNICEF,and VEDCO organized a field assessment for Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene from 22nd - 23rd February. The assessment involved visitsto the border points, proposed settlement site, a health facility, school and water and sanitation infrastructure in and around theproposed siteVEDCO:
In this emergency response project, VEDCO will focus on hygiene promotion by planning and implementing interventions that will enable refugees to take action to prevent and/or mitigate water, sanitation and hygiene-related diseases. This willinvolve ensuring that refugee make the best use of the hygiene-enabling facilitiesand services provided by VEDCO as well as water, and sanitation facilities provided by other agencies like LWF and UNICEF. and other aand includes the effective operation and maintenance of the facilities. VEDCO will therefore promote the following hygeine promotion interventions: 1)Conduct Hygiene Behavior change education among refugee households, schools and refugee hosting communities through mutual sharing of information and knowledge-Hygiene promotion,2)Mobilisation of refugees, schools and host communities to take action through putting in place hygiene promotion structures. 3)Provision of essential hygiene materials and facilities
Addressing WASH will lead to improved hygienic pratcises leading to reduction in prevalence of water born diseases.Addressing gender and social protection issues will lead to improved relationships among refugees and host communities. There will also be increased participation in of women in decision making, more enrollmentof girls in schools and more unity amongrefugees and host communities.

participating-org.narrative:
VEDCO (Voluntary Efforts for Development Concern) was founded in 1986 by a group of university students in response to challenges of poverty, caused by the military conflicts of 1980-1986. While a relief mentality had developed after the war, VEDCO decided to promote food security and economic activity, such as to achieve self-reliance of the communities of Luweero. VEDCO's mission is to empower small, medium-scale farms as well as micro-entrepreneurs through capacity-building, agricultural trade development and access tomicro-finance. The organisation got its formal registration as a company limited in 1991. VEDCO and the farmers it works with, havedeveloped a detailed definition of food security: at least 2 ha of food crops, availability of at least 15 fruit trees, a kitchen garden, three pigs and compost making and the use of sustainable agriculture techniques. Together with 150 rural development extensionists, who are farmers, a broad range of farmers is trained in these techniques. By the end of 2003, 3000 farm households had achieved food security according to this definition. With farmers from food secure households, VEDCO continues to work under the agricultural trade program. VEDCO facilitates farmers organisation and links them with agricultural traders who enter into contract with groups of farmers for the regular supply of agricultural crops for (export) marketing. They provide training for these farmers on quality standards, crop treatment, storage, transport and marketing. End 2003, VEDCO worked with 700 of such commercialising farmers. For 250 of these, VEDCO was able to demonstrate tangible improvement in their livelihoods such as increased school enrolment, improved housing and re-investing of profits in the business.
In the period 2001-2003, VEDCO received a grant from the EU, under co-financingarrangement with Oxfam Novib, Hivos and German Agro Action.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
